author: Kate O'Keeffe
description: American officials thought they’d secured a deal with TuSimple to protect autonomous-driving technology. It didn’t work.
title: Saga of Chinese Trucking Firm Exposes US National Security Gaps

author: Peter Millard, Mariana Durao, Beatriz Amat
description: The big wins by Democrats in Tuesday’s elections across the US turned into a rallying cry at an environmental conference in Rio de Janeiro.
title: Climate-Friendly Mayors Find Hope in Trump’s Election Setback

description: Zohran Mamdani pulled off a historic win in New York’s mayoral race with pledges to make life more affordable. Now he faces the challenge of making them a reality and winning over Wall Street.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Can Mamdani Win Over Wall Street?

author: Matthew Campbell
description: The inside story of how two alleged murder plots brought India, the US and Canada to a diplomatic crisis.
title: The Attacks on Sikh Separatists That Rocked India’s Relations With the West

author: Alicia Diaz
description: House Democrat Jared Golden said he won’t seek reelection, opening up a ripe opportunity for Republicans to pick up a congressional seat in his competitive Maine district.
title: Golden Retiring From Most Pro-Trump US House Seat Democrats Hold

author: Magdalena Del Valle
description: The US is asking the United Nations Security Council to lift sanctions on Syria’s president before he visits the White House next week, furthering President Donald Trump’s efforts to support the country’s new government after a decade of civil war.
title: US Wants Sanctions Relief for Syria Leader Before Trump Meeting

author: Sommer Saadi, Stephanie Flanders
description: The former Chicago mayor says pouring money into research and education is the way to make the “American Dream” viable. He also won’t rule out a run for president.
title: Rahm Emanuel’s Recipe for America Is Getting ‘Back to Basics’

author: Gregory Korte
description: Both parties look to redrawing political maps for partisan advantage.
title: Welcome to the Era of ‘Perpetual Redistricting’ for a Political Edge

author: Michael Shepard, Oma Seddiq
description: House Judiciary Committee Chair Jim Jordan sent a subpoena to OpenAI Chief Executive Officer Sam Altman demanding information on the artificial intelligence startup’s engagement with foreign governments about complying with rules that Jordan said could impact Americans’ free speech rights.
title: Key House Republican Presses OpenAI’s Altman Over Foreign Rules

author: Kate Sullivan
description: President Donald Trump championed US attacks on Venezuelan vessels during a speech at a business event Wednesday in Miami, in his latest saber-rattling toward the Nicolas Maduro regime.
title: Trump Hails Venezuela Vessel Attacks at Miami Business Forum

author: Erik Larson
description: Here are five key takeaways from the hearing Wednesday at the US Supreme Court over the legality of tariffs imposed by President Donald Trump:
title: Key Takeaways From the US Supreme Court Hearing on Trump Tariffs

author: Kamil Kowalcze
description: German lawmakers approved more than €1.9 billion ($2.2 billion) in new defense procurements as part of a sweeping overhaul of its armed forces following Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.
title: Germany Clears €1.9 Billion in Defense Orders in Military Boost

author: Nacha Cattan
description: New York Police Commissioner Jessica Tisch is willing to remain in her post under Zohran Mamdani as long as the progressive mayor-elect allows her to keep pursuing her agenda, according to people with knowledge of the matter.
title: NYC Police Head Tisch Tells Confidants She’d Work for Mamdani

author: Matthew Malinowski, Patricia Garip
description: Chile’s leading presidential candidate Jeannette Jara is a communist. Not that kind of communist, she wants you to know.
title: Lifelong Communist Goes Mainstream in Bid for Chile’s Top Job

author: Aashna Shah
description: The US Federal Aviation Administration issued a ground delay for flights bound for Newark Liberty International Airport on Wednesday due to air traffic control staffing constraints.
title: Newark Airport Sees Flight Delays as Government Shutdown Drags

author: Lucy White
description: Nigel Farage’s Reform UK is drawing up plans for a broad shake-up of financial regulation, taxation and pensions in a bid to revive Britain’s economy if the party comes to power after the next election due by 2029.
title: Farage’s Reform Plans City Shake-Up to Boost UK Economic Growth

author: Nojoud Al Mallees
description: The Canadian government is set to launch special initiatives to attract top international researchers and H-1B visa holders, while slashing the number of foreign students it plans to bring into the country each year.
title: Canada to Poach H-1B Visa Holders, International Researchers

author: Steven T. Dennis
description: The peculiar US political phenomenon known as the filibuster is once again in focus. The filibuster is the prerogative enjoyed by the minority party in the Senate to demand never-ending debate to thwart legislation, which must be approved by both that body and the House of Representatives.
title: Trump Is Calling for the ‘Nuclear Option’ to Kill the Filibuster. What’s That Mean?

author: Nacha Cattan, Leah Nylen
description: New York City Mayor-Elect Zohran Mamdani tapped former Federal Trade Commission chair Lina Khan to his transition team, a figure who raised the ire of big businesses and dealmakers with her tough approach to antitrust cases.
title: NYC’s Mamdani Names Ex-FTC Chief Lina Khan to Transition Team

author: Augusta Saraiva
description: Fallout from lethal police raids in Rio de Janeiro and mounting regional fears about US military intervention in Venezuela are threatening to overshadow the major United Nations climate summit set to begin in Brazil.
title: Rio Mayhem, Venezuela Crisis Threaten to Eclipse Brazil’s UN Climate Summit

author: Greg Ryan
description: Nantucket residents voted to preserve their right to rent properties to short-term visitors, capping years of acrimony on the Massachusetts island over how to balance its tourism economy with a housing crunch.
title: Nantucket Weekends Are Saved as Voters Back Lax Rental Rules

author: Laura Nahmias, Georgia Hall
description: Zohran Mamdani is set to take on what’s considered the second-hardest job in the US: running New York City. His biggest challenge will be dealing with the man with the tougher job, President Donald Trump.
title: Mamdani’s ‘Trump-Proofing NYC’ Campaign Sets Up Fight With White House

author: Myles Miller
description: New York City Fire Commissioner Robert Tucker will step down next month, becoming the first senior official to resign on the heels of Zohran Mamdani’s decisive win of the mayoralty Tuesday.
title: NYC Fire Commissioner to Resign Over Mamdani’s Stance on Israel

author: Erik Wasson, Gregory Korte
description: Government shutdowns have become a recurring feature of US politics, the product of partisan standoffs over spending that force federal agencies to halt a wide range of services. The latest shutdown — the third under President Donald Trump across his two terms — began at midnight on Oct. 1, when Congress failed to pass a stopgap funding measure, triggering the nation’s first government closure in almost seven years. On Nov. 5, it entered its 36th day, making it the longest shutdown in history.
title: The US Government Shutdown Is the Longest Ever. Why Does This Keep Happening?

author: Fadwa Hodali, Dan Williams
description: Hamas said it would consider giving up missiles and rockets as part of a ceasefire with Israel, a sign the group is prepared to make further concessions toward the US-brokered roadmap for peace.
title: Hamas Gives First Indication of Ceding Arms in Gaza Ceasefire

author: Gregory Korte
description: California’s vote on Tuesday to redraw its congressional maps marks an escalation of a protracted redistricting arms race, in which voters can expect an explosion of partisan gerrymandering before every election.
title: California Vote Signals New Era of Perpetual Redistricting

author: Greg Stohr
description: US Supreme Court justices questioned President Donald Trump’s global tariffs, as arguments began in a case that could undercut his signature economic policy.
title: Justices Question Legality of Trump’s Tariffs at Supreme Court

author: Carolina Millan, Gonzalo Soto
description: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum said she will pursue charges against a man who groped and attempted to kiss her as she was walking in the capital’s historical center on Tuesday.
title: Sheinbaum Seeks Charges After Being Groped by Man in Mexico City

author: Tom Rees
description: Britain’s embattled statistics agency will stop producing swathes of its data after a crisis affecting crucial economic figures was worsened by it “doing too much, too quickly and on too many fronts.”
title: UK Stats Office Prepares to Cut Back Data After ‘Doing Too Much’

author: Greg Sullivan
description: President Vladimir Putin said Russia has no plans to violate existing agreements on nuclear testing, but signaled that he’s ready to order them if Donald Trump moves forward with threatened US atomic weapons trials.
title: Putin Warns Russia May Commence Nuclear Tests After Trump Threat

author: Ellen Milligan
description: UK police are urgently searching for a second foreign offender accidentally released from prison last week, the latest error that risks becoming a political storm for Labour Prime Minister Keir Starmer.
title: UK Launches Hunt for Second Foreign Criminal Mistakenly Freed

author: Emily Birnbaum, Skylar Woodhouse
description: President Donald Trump blamed the ongoing government shutdown for Democrats’ sweeping electoral wins, pressuring Republicans to abandon the filibuster in order to reopen federal agencies and pass new crackdowns on mail-in voting.
title: Trump Urges Senate to Kill Filibuster After Democratic Wins

author: Joe Lovinger
description: Voters in Austin overwhelmingly blocked a property tax increase that would have raised tens of millions of dollars to support homeless people and pay for other services, a rejection of increased municipal spending in one of the most reliably Democratic cities in Texas.
title: Austin, Texas Rejects Tax Increase for Homeless Relief

description: The US Supreme Court in Washington on Nov. 4. Photographer: Pete Kiehart/Bloomberg
title: Trump Tariffs Challenged Before US Supreme Court

author: Eamon Farhat
description: Drax Group Plc has signed a low-carbon contract for difference with the UK government covering its four biomass units, finalizing an agreement that analysts had expected to be delayed until next year.
title: UK’s Drax Finalizes Deal For Government Biomass Subsidies

author: Simon Marks
description: An estimated 150,000 people have died in Sudan’s 30-month civil war.
title: A Brutal African Conflict Resists Trump’s Peace Efforts

author: Jarrell Dillard, Josyana Joshua
description: Past shutdowns have left only temporary scars, but this time is different
title: Longest Shutdown in History Costs US Economy About $15 Billion Each Week

author: Suttinee Yuvejwattana
description: The Thai government will set up a special team to track suspicious fund movements linked to online gambling, scam accounts, and other “gray money” transactions.
title: Thailand Is Hunting Down ‘Gray Money’ Behind Baht’s Odd Strength

author: Emele Onu
description: Nigeria began a sale of benchmark dollar debt, joining other African issuers taking advantage of lower borrowing costs.
title: Nigeria Opens Eurobond Offer Seeking to Raise $2.25 Billion

author: Ewa Krukowska
description: European Union member states sealed a deal to reduce emissions by 90% through 2040 compared with 1990 levels, a move that bolsters the bloc’s climate leadership credentials ahead of the COP30 summit.
title: EU Nations Seal Deal on 2040 Climate Goal to Cut 90% Emissions

author: David Ramli
description: Singapore has ceased providing tax incentives to two single family offices linked to individuals associated with Prince Group, described by the US as one of Asia’s largest crime syndicates.
title: Singapore Cuts Tax Breaks for Prince Group-Linked Family Offices

author: Simon Marks
description: Sudan’s army rebuffed a US proposal for a ceasefire and said it will rally public support to fight rebels who’ve captured much of the western half of the country.
title: Sudan Army Rebuffs US Ceasefire Proposal, Prepares to Fight On

author: Ted Mann
description: Wins in New Jersey, Virginia, NYC give guide to midterm campaigns.
title: Democrats Take Their Election Wins and Turn to 2026 Midterms

author: Nancy Cook
description: Democrats swept the three major local elections in the US on Tuesday by wider-than-expected margins, giving the beleaguered party a much-needed boost 10 months into President Donald Trump’s second term.
title: Democratic Victories Give Party a Roadmap for Beating Trump

author: Gregory Korte
description: The US government has reached a major milestone of dysfunction as Congress has allowed a federal shutdown to drag into its 36th day — the longest in history — amid a stalemate over health-care and spending priorities.
title: Longest Shutdown Tests Air Travel, Federal Workers and Patience

author: Josh Xiao, Hallie Gu
description: China has halted retaliatory tariffs that it imposed on a range of US agricultural products, after Washington officially halved its fentanyl-related levies on Chinese goods.
title: China Ends Levies on US Farm Products After Fentanyl Tariff Cuts

author: Robert Burnson
description: The Trump administration faces a new challenge in the battle over food assistance benefits amid a federal funding lapse — a lawsuit filed by recipients who say they’re in danger of going hungry.
title: Low-Income Americans Sue Trump Officials to Fund Food Benefits

author: Eliyahu Kamisher
description: California voters approved a ballot measure intended to shift as many as five congressional seats to Democrats from Republicans, handing Governor Gavin Newsom a major political victory in his fight against President Donald Trump.
title: California Approves New Congressional Maps in Triumph for Newsom

author: Soo-Hyang Choi
description: North Korea is preparing for a potential summit meeting between leader Kim Jong Un and President Donald Trump as the idea was broached during Trump’s recent visit to Asia, based on an assessment by South Korea’s National Intelligence Service.
title: North Korea Prepares for Potential Trump-Kim Meeting, Seoul Says

description: Zohran Mamdani was elected the 111th mayor of New York in a historic victory that will put an avowed democratic socialist in charge of the city that serves as the capital of global finance. Julie Fine discusses Mamdani's win on Insight with Haslinda Amin. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: What Mamdani’s Historic Win Means for Trump

author: Laura Nahmias
description: Zohran Mamdani was elected the 111th mayor of New York in a historic victory that will put an avowed democratic socialist in charge of the city that serves as the capital of global finance.
title: Mamdani Beats Cuomo in Race for Mayor of New York City

author: Georgia Hall
description: Democratic US Representative Mikie Sherrill won the race for governor of New Jersey, defeating a Republican backed by Donald Trump and giving her party a boost heading into next year’s midterm elections.
title: NJ Elects Sherrill as Governor in Boost for Democrats in 2026

author: Akshat Rathi
description: The decision makes it harder for Brazil, the summit host, to raise $125 billion toward the fund that’s designed to protect tropical forests.
title: UK Will Not Invest in Brazilian Forest Fund Key to COP30

author: Daniel Carvalho, Augusta Saraiva
description: President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva is taking a break from the United Nations climate summit he’s hosting in Brazil to join discussions on the Venezuela crisis in Colombia this weekend.
title: Lula to Take a Break From COP30 to Discuss Venezuela

author: Alicia Diaz
description: Abigail Spanberger was elected governor in Virginia, riding a message that President Donald Trump’s stewardship of the economy and his overhaul of the federal government hasn’t improved the livelihood of voters in the commonwealth.
title: Spanberger Wins Virginia Governor Seat in Pickup for Democrats

author: Thomas Seal, Laura Dhillon Kane
description: A lawmaker defected from Canada’s opposition Conservative Party to the governing Liberals, a move that helps Prime Minister Mark Carney’s minority government pass its first federal budget in an upcoming vote.
title: Canadian Lawmaker Defects to Carney’s Liberals After Budget Presented

author: Jennah Haque, Raeedah Wahid
description: New Yorkers are flocking to the polls at the fastest pace in decades, with 1,748,698 votes recorded by 6 p.m. Tuesday, according to the city’s Board of Elections. That total includes about 735,000 cast during the early voting period.
title: New York City Mayor’s Race Sees Highest Turnout in Decades

author: James Woolcock
description: The UK government joined forces with dozens of major employers to promote occupational health care in an effort to reverse a surge in adults out of work.
title: UK Enlists 60 Big Employers in Drive to Improve Worker Health

author: Shawn Donnan, Laura Curtis, Enda Curran
description: President Donald Trump has worked fast in his second term, wielding unilateral power to reassert American dominance in the global economy. For a few hours Wednesday, the world will get clues as to whether any US institution is willing to rein him in.
title: Supreme Court Confronts Trump’s Power to Disrupt Global Economy
